channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ROO-1781] High CPU usage for 5 mins during startup
item.description:
When I launch Roo in my project folder it eats CPU for ~5 mins, using 200% of CPU for approx half of that time, then dropping to 100% for the remainder of that time.

It's bogging down Eclipse/STS, although I get identical problems running Roo at a command prompt.

My project has ~50 entities (all scaffolded) and I have another 80 or so classes elsewhere in the project. Not a trivial amount, but not huge either. I've currently got no generated tests in the project, because then Roo takes even longer to start up.

Don't know if it makes any difference, but my project also has some GWT components in it, because I'm also using Vaadin libs.

I'm using Oracle's JRockit VM - but I am experiencing these delays no matter what VM I choose.

I have tried different settings for -Xms and -Xmx, but that made no noticeable difference.

Here's some diagnostic info:-

localhost$ time roo metadata status
____ ____ ____
/ __ \/ __ \/ __ \
/ /_/ / / / / / / /

Roo exited with code 0

real 4m11.758s
user 5m16.356s
sys 1m29.106s
localhost$

I have a bunch of jstack traces also: I've taken a selection of samples during this high CPU startup period. I'll attach a zip containing 5 traces from the early startup phase (when CPU is 200%), and 5 from the later phase (when CPU is 100%).

If you want stack traces on a different VM, or any other info, let me know.

Thanks,
Jim
item.environment:
Ubuntu 10.10 'Maverick' with kernel 2.6.36-020636-generic i686
Oracle JRockit(R) (build R28.0.1-21-133393-1.6.0_20-20100512-2126-linux-ia32, compiled mode)
item.summary: High CPU usage for 5 mins during startup

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I've put the metadata status data into a Google Chart, for giggles.

http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chxs=0,676767,11&chxt=x&chs=900x300&cht=p&chco=49188F,3366CC,BBCCED&chds=0,194309&chd=t:375,116,1308,1727,2336,2703,5674,5850,6065,7463,7785,194309&chdl=org.springframework.roo.process.manager.internal.DefaultFileManager|org.springframework.roo.addon.configurable.ConfigurableMetadata|org.springframework.roo.addon.javabean.JavaBeanMetadata|org.springframework.roo.classpath.PhysicalTypeIdentifier|org.springframework.roo.addon.entity.EntityMetadata|org.springframework.roo.addon.tostring.ToStringMetadata|org.springframework.roo.project.AutomaticProjectUpgradeService|org.springframework.roo.addon.web.mvc.controller.WebScaffoldMetadata|org.springframework.roo.addon.finder.FinderMetadata|org.springframework.roo.addon.beaninfo.BeanInfoMetadata|org.springframework.roo.addon.plural.PluralMetadata|org.springframework.roo.addon.web.mvc.jsp.JspMetadata&chdlp=l&chl=DefaultFileManager|ConfigurableMetadata|JavaBeanMetadata|PhysicalTypeIdentifier|EntityMetadata|ToStringMetadata|AutomaticProjectUpgradeService|WebScaffoldMetadata|FinderMetadata|BeanInfoMetadata|PluralMetadata|JspMetadata&chma=0,0,10|300,250&chtt=metadata+status&chts=676767,14

Maybe the link won't work in here though.
Can you try with the latest Roo code from Git.

Hi Alan,

For me, Roo git fails to build at present (fwiw, I've done it before sucessfully). I simply did:-

git clone git://git.springsource.org/roo/roo.git roo-dev
cd roo-dev
mvn clean install

Here's where it failed:-

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Building Spring Roo - Addon - JDBC Driver Acquisition
[INFO] task-segment: [install]
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
Downloading: http://repository.springsource.com/maven/bundles/release/org/springframework/roo/wrapping/1.1.1.RELEASE/wrapping-1.1.1.RELEASE.pom
[INFO] Unable to find resource 'org.springframework.roo:wrapping:pom:1.1.1.RELEASE' in repository com.springsource.repository.bundles.release (http://repository.springsource.com/maven/bundles/release)
Downloading: http://repository.springsource.com/maven/bundles/external/org/springframework/roo/wrapping/1.1.1.RELEASE/wrapping-1.1.1.RELEASE.pom
[INFO] Unable to find resource 'org.springframework.roo:wrapping:pom:1.1.1.RELEASE' in repository com.springsource.repository.bundles.external (http://repository.springsource.com/maven/bundles/external)
Downloading: http://spring-roo-repository.springsource.org/release/org/springframework/roo/wrapping/1.1.1.RELEASE/wrapping-1.1.1.RELEASE.pom
[INFO] Unable to find resource 'org.springframework.roo:wrapping:pom:1.1.1.RELEASE' in repository spring-roo-repository (http://spring-roo-repository.springsource.org/release)
Downloading: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/springframework/roo/wrapping/1.1.1.RELEASE/wrapping-1.1.1.RELEASE.pom
[INFO] Unable to find resource 'org.springframework.roo:wrapping:pom:1.1.1.RELEASE' in repository central (http://repo1.maven.org/maven2)
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] BUILD ERROR
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Error building POM (may not be this project's POM).

Project ID: org.springframework.roo.wrapping:$

{pom.groupId}.${pkgArtifactId}:bundle:${osgiVersion}

Reason: Cannot find parent: org.springframework.roo:wrapping for project: org.springframework.roo.wrapping:${pom.groupId}

.$

{pkgArtifactId}:bundle:${osgiVersion} for project org.springframework.roo.wrapping:${pom.groupId}.${pkgArtifactId}

:bundle:$

{osgiVersion}

I don't know if this is a user-problem here at my end, or if you've got some magic in a parent pom that I don't have, or if the public repo is somehow out of sync...?

Let me know if I need to build it differently – or when you've fixed the build/pom/deps – and I'll give it another shot.

Cheers,
/J

Ah - I've taken another look and I see it's a problem with my build; I wasn't building Roo's wrappings before the main project, which I fixed with:-

cd wrapping && mvn clean install && cd .. && mvn clean install

But now on instantiating Roo git in my existing project, I'm getting an exception (filed as ROO-1795) which temporarily blocks my progress here.

/J

Hi Alan,

Using Roo git instead of 1.1.0 actually makes the startup time slightly longer: 8m58s vs 8m18s on this run. (FWIW: CPU usage throughout that time seems consistently at 200% with Roo git)

Find the output below, both from Roo git (pulled an hour ago) and from Roo 1.1.0 (my project has changed a little since the original timings; it's only fair to compare both sets of timings on the same code base)

The timing run for Roo git isn't the first run - I let it manage any files it needed to first before quitting and doing a timing run.

Hope that helps?

Let me know if you want stack traces - or if there is better way of profiling the execution.

Cheers,
/J

Hi Jim/Alan,

I have been experiencing a similar performance issue on start up for a while now. I'm not sure if it's an issue introduced in a particular Roo version, or if the issue has always been there and is only significant in larger projects. We also have approximately 50 entities, no GWT, no roo-generated integration tests. Start up time feel around 5-10 minutes on my laptop (Windows 7, 2.5GHz core-2 duo, 4GB Ram). We're currently using Roo 1.1.0-Release.

Generally once Roo has started up performance is ok.

If there is anything I can do to help troubleshoot / diagnose this issue, then please let me know.

Cheers.
This is related to the improvements currently being worked on in ROO-1831, so I'm closing this one so we can consolidate votes/feedback in one place.
